net.sourceforge.waters.plain.module

Class EdgeElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.plain.base.Element
      • net.sourceforge.waters.plain.module.EdgeElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Proxy, EdgeProxy

    public final class EdgeElement
extends Element
implements EdgeProxy
    An immutable implementation of the EdgeProxy interface.
    Author:
    Robi Malik
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • EdgeElement

        public EdgeElement(NodeProxy source,
                   NodeProxy target,
                   LabelBlockProxy labelBlock,
                   GuardActionBlockProxy guardActionBlock,
                   SplineGeometryProxy geometry,
                   PointGeometryProxy startPoint,
                   PointGeometryProxy endPoint)
        Creates a new edge.
        Parameters:
        source - The source node of the new edge, or null.
        target - The target node of the new edge, or null.
        labelBlock - The label block of the new edge, or null if empty.
        guardActionBlock - The guard action block of the new edge, or null.
        geometry - The rendering information of the new edge, or null.
        startPoint - The rendering information for the start point of the new edge, or null.
        endPoint - The rendering information for the end point of the new edge, or null.

      • EdgeElement

        public EdgeElement()
        Creates a new edge using default values. This constructor creates an edge with the source node set to null, the target node set to null, an empty label block, the guard action block set to null, the rendering information set to null, the rendering information for the start point set to null, and the rendering information for the end point set to null.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public EdgeElement clone()
        Description copied from class: Element
        Creates and returns a copy of this element. Immutable objects of the plain implementation are cloned by shallow copying. All contained objects are shared between an element and its clones.
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Proxy
        Overrides:
        clone in class Element

      • getProxyInterface

        public Class<EdgeProxy> getProxyInterface()
        Description copied from interface: Proxy
        Returns the most specific proxy interface implemented by this object. This method must return one of the leaf interfaces of the proxy hierarchy, e.g. EventProxy, not any specific implementation class. This can be used by equality visitors to ensure that objects from different implementations are considered as equal.
        Specified by:
        getProxyInterface in interface Proxy

      • getLabelBlock

        public LabelBlockProxy getLabelBlock()
        Description copied from interface: EdgeProxy
        Gets the label block of this edge. The label block contains a list of labels, each representing one event and therefore one transition in the automaton obtained from this graph.
        Specified by:
        getLabelBlock in interface EdgeProxy

      • getGuardActionBlock

        public GuardActionBlockProxy getGuardActionBlock()
        Specified by:
        getGuardActionBlock in interface EdgeProxy

      • getGeometry

        public SplineGeometryProxy getGeometry()
        Description copied from interface: EdgeProxy
        Gets the rendering information for this edge.
        Specified by:
        getGeometry in interface EdgeProxy
        Returns:
        A spline geometry object containing the control points for the edge, or null if the edge is rendered as a straight line. The spline geometry does not contain the start and end points of the edge, as these can be obtained from the position of the source and target nodes, or the #getStartPoint() and #getEndPoint() methods.

      • getStartPoint

        public PointGeometryProxy getStartPoint()
        Description copied from interface: EdgeProxy
        Gets the rendering information for the start point of this edge. For most edges, the location of the start point is the position of the source node. But in some cases, namely if the source node is a group node (GroupNodeProxy), an alternative start position may be specified.
        Specified by:
        getStartPoint in interface EdgeProxy
        Returns:
        A point geometry object defining an alternative start point, or null if the start point is obtained from the position of the source node.

      • getEndPoint

        public PointGeometryProxy getEndPoint()
        Description copied from interface: EdgeProxy
        Gets the rendering information for the end point of this edge. For most edges, the location of the end point is the position of the target node. But in some cases, namely if the target node is a group node (GroupNodeProxy), an alternative end position may be specified. This only makes sense in a nondeterministic graph.
        Specified by:
        getEndPoint in interface EdgeProxy
        Returns:
        A point geometry object defining an alternative end point, or null if the end point is obtained from the position of the target node.
